freeports_analysis.consts

Provide basic constant and types used by all submodules, should facilitate avoiding circular imports

Classes

Concrete class representing bond financial instruments.

class freeports_analysis.consts.Bond(page: int, targets: List[str], company: str, subfund: str, nominal_quantity: int, market_value: float, currency: Currency, perc_net_assets: float, acquisition_cost: float = None, maturity: date = None, interest_rate: float = None)

Concrete class representing bond financial instruments.

Extends FinancialData with bond-specific attributes including maturity date and interest rate.

maturity

The maturity date of the bond.

Type:

datetime.date, optional

interest_rate

The interest rate of the bond (should be between 0 and 1).

Type:

float, optional

property instrument: FinancialInstrument

Identifies this instrument as BOND type.

Returns:

Always returns FinancialInstrument.BOND

Return type:

FinancialInstrument

Type:

FinancialInstrument

property interest_rate: float

The interest rate of the bond.

Returns:

The interest rate value

Return type:

float

Notes

Logs a warning if interest rate is not normalized (0-1 range).

Type:

float or None

property maturity: date

The maturity date of the bond.

Type:

datetime.date or None

to_dict()

Cast financial data to python dictionary

Returns:

casted data

Return type:

dict

class freeports_analysis.consts.Currency(*values)

Enumeration of supported currency codes.

Contains standard 3-letter ISO currency codes for major world currencies.

class freeports_analysis.consts.Equity(page: int, targets: List[str], company: str, subfund: str, nominal_quantity: int, market_value: float, currency: Currency, perc_net_assets: float, acquisition_cost: float = None)

Concrete class representing equity financial instruments.

Inherits from FinancialData and implements the instrument property to identify as EQUITY type.

property instrument: FinancialInstrument

Identifies this instrument as EQUITY type.

Returns:

Always returns FinancialInstrument.EQUITY

Return type:

FinancialInstrument

Type:

FinancialInstrument

class freeports_analysis.consts.FinancialData(page: int, targets: List[str], company: str, subfund: str, nominal_quantity: int, market_value: float, currency: Currency, perc_net_assets: float, acquisition_cost: float = None)

Abstract base class representing financial data.

This class serves as the foundation for specific financial instrument types, providing common attributes and validation.

page

The page number where the financial data appears (must be positive).

Type:

int

targets

The list of companies to search for, used as company validation

Type:

List[str]

company

The name of the company or issuer.

Type:

str

market_value

The current market value of the instrument.

Type:

float

currency

The currency in which the value is denominated.

Type:

Currency

perc_net_assets

Percentage of net assets (must be between 0 and 1).

Type:

float

subfund

The subfund to which this instrument belongs.

Type:

str

nominal_quantity

The nominal quantity of the instrument, if applicable.

Type:

int, optional

acquisition_cost

The original acquisition cost of the instrument.

Type:

float, optional

Raises:

ValueError – If perc_net_assets is not between 0 and 1. If page is not a positive number. If company is not in targets.

property acquisition_cost: float

The original acquisition cost of the instrument.

Type:

float or None

property company: str

The name of the company or issuer.

Type:

str

property currency: Currency

The currency in which the value is denominated.

Type:

Currency

abstract property instrument: FinancialInstrument

Abstract property to identify the financial instrument type. :returns: The type of financial instrument (EQUITY, BOND, etc.) :rtype: FinancialInstrument

property market_value: float

The current market value of the instrument.

Type:

float

property nominal_quantity: int

The nominal quantity of the instrument, if applicable.

Type:

int or None

property page: int

The page number where the financial data appears.

Type:

int

property perc_net_assets: float

Percentage of net assets (between 0 and 1).

Type:

float

property subfund: str

The subfund to which this instrument belongs.

Type:

str

to_dict() → dict

Cast financial data to python dictionary

Returns:

casted data

Return type:

dict
